alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Scott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Scott and western Harrison Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Cynthiana, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Scott and western Harrison Counties, including the following locations... Robinson, Colemansville, Breckinridge, Alberta, Renaker, Rutland, Berry, Boyd, Sadieville and Antioch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
